channel.title: Valery Ozenne
channel.description:
Reproducible Science is good.
Replicated Science is better.

item.title: Anne Josset’s PhD defense for which I served as examinateur.
item.description: Anne Josset’s PhD defense for which I served as examinateur

item.title: Joao Magnus Bailuni de Bragança is joining the team
item.description: Joao Magnus Bailuni de Bragança is doing his PhD with Cesar Cunha Pacheco in Rio de Janeiro at the Universidade Federal Fluminense. He obtained funding from the Brazilian agency CAPES to spend 6 months of his PhD in France at the CRMSB. We welcome him to Bordeaux.

item.title: A second application is now opened for a master position in MRI and thermorégulation
item.description: L’offre détaillée est accessible à ce lien Pour toute question, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter.

item.title: Defense day for Pierre Cabanis
item.description: Pierre Cabanis’s PhD defense And also my first PhD defense as PhD advisor.

item.title: Welcome to Nino Avetikovi who will start her PhD
item.description: Nino Avetikovi, former student at PHELMA, is starting a PhD with Jean-Luc Battaglia and me at I2M and CRMSB, respectively. We welcome her to Bordeaux.

item.title: Application is now opened for a master position in MRI and neuroscience
item.description: L’offre détaillée est accessible à ce lien Pour toute question, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter.

item.title: L'écosysteme Mille-Feuilles démarre
item.description:
L’écosysteme Mille-Feuilles est une suite logicielle avec une forte emphase sur la microstructure cardiaque. Le premier service intégrant une base de donnée publique est maintenant opérationnelle.

Le site github avec une description très brève des fonctionnalité link

La base de donnée publique link

item.title: Application is now opened for a PhD position in personalized image-guided therapies
Rebecca-Lafont is joining the team
item.description: Rebecca-Lafont, student at PHELMA, is doing her 2nd year internship at IHU-LIRYC for 3 months. We welcome her to Bordeaux.

item.title: Elodie Kopp is joining the team
item.description: Elodie Kopp is doing her project of engineering school over the spring-summer 2024 period. In collaboration with Alexandre Xenon, she will develop non-invasive and volumetric thermometric mapping technique using MR spectroscopy protocol to study fatigue. We welcome her to Bordeaux.
